review: Overwatch 2 may basically just be a pay wall but it doesn't make it a bad game, you don't need the battle pass to have fun and get skins they give you legacy points which after awhile of collecting them you'll be able to get skins and anything, then after a season of the character being out they give you quests to do to unlock them. Overwatch in general is a good game all the heros are unique in there own way which makes it more diverse in gameplay. And yes I do agree everything is overpriced a skin should not cost a whole $10 for one character so just use legacy points to get them like I said earlier.

Complete and utter downgrade from OW1. The new character changes feel awful, the "new" maps are lazy, and the way the game itself is, is just a shadow of it's former self. Once again, bowing down to the lame competitive crowd ruins a game.

If you didn't play Overwatch during the first month of it's original release, you never played Overwatch.

This game is ass, and the purchases don't even work.

At least it's better than TF2.
Bring back OW 1 like monetization and this review will be positive

Overwatch 2 improves upon the elements that made OW1  so great. 5v5 makes the game much more fluid and eliminates the frustrations caused by many tank combo defining metas. the CC reduction has also been great benefit to gameplay as well as the elimination of 2CP. The Overwatch Devs have done a great job pumping life back into this game despite the mismanagement of their leadership in Blizzard. The game is not in a perfect spot, but i believe it is on a good trajectory to recover from its passed sins that all stemmed from the OW2 announcement back in 2018-2019 that never should have taken place. The delivery of product and past promises has been the games biggest issue, the actual product is great.

every season is more and more greedy. they literally only care about money. The artists, writers, and coders times have been wasted by corporate ass hats

The first button was to a shop with a lame battlepass, overpriced skins and low tier co-op missions locked behind a paywall.

Actually playing the game, it felt like a corpse of the old game I loved being puppeteered to get me to pay for a $28 skin in a game I already paid full price for. 

All the talent and passion left Blizzard long ago.

You have to be a certain type of deranged to support this game after Blizzard provided 0 updates about game status for 3 years then released an update that provided minimal content on the PVP side AND delayed the PVE by at least a year WHILE removing the skill trees and randomization that was promised and hyped up for years. Don't forget that Blizz is also CHARGING MONEY for the PVE in addition to the battlepass costs. 

OW had one of the better lootbox & content drops systems and all that got removed into paying incredibly high prices for skins too so it would be a better use of your time as a new player to pay like $15-30 for an older account loaded with cosmetics if youre a new player. 

OW1 was an amazing game and time flew playing it but OW2 can never get that charm back. Go pickup a souls game or doom eternal or some other PEAK GAMING EXPERIENCE during a steam sale for the $15-25 youd pay getting the battlepass + pve missions in OW2 youll enjoy it a lot more!
This is a sleazy cash grab. Bring back Overwatch 1.

this game does not like you and so do the developers

[b] the guys [/b]

I only downloaded the game on steam cuz i just had to put my two cents out there.

Firstly, i would like to point out the problem with this game is [b]NOT[/b] any unbalanced hero or abilities, [b]NOT[/b] game design, [b]NOT[/b] devs, [b]NOT[/b] the community [b]NOR[/b] the players but the Blizzard management; specifically Bobby. You can watch the video(s) of former Blizzard employees on youtube and learn more about the situation; basically Bobby is a total d1ckh3ad and does not give two f's about anything other than filling his pockets as much as he can before the Microsoft acquisition and his replacement (which i REALLY hope will happen). He is the one and only mastermind behind the downfall of Overwatch. He is the reason they pushed the Overwatch league so hard and the reason PVE was cancelled and we now get only an hour worth of missions that cost you 15$ instead of a dedicated hero mode with talent trees (which is what the pve was supposed to be).

The fact that new heroes are paywalled behind a premium battle pass is so sad.

That said I really LOVE this game though. Ever since i got OW1 back in the day the gameplay just never ceased to impress me. It's very intense, chaotic and there are just so many different ways you can play it with a huge amount of diverse heroes.

[h1]Overall i wouldn't really recommend the game.[/h1]
